patterns: How can I find accommodation in Cham?
Where can I get accommodation in Deggendorf?
Where can I get accommodation in Cham?
Where can I get accommodation in Pfarrkirchen?
How to find the accommodation?
Where can I find accommodation details?
Where can I find accommodation?
responses: https://www.th-deg.de/de/studieninteressierte/wohnen or Homepage -> Study with us -> practical information -> Accommodation

You can search for accommodation on different searching platforms, like the DIT’s flat rental website (https://pmit-ext.th-deg.de/wb/search), WG-gesucht (private online platform, mainly for shared flats - https://www.wg-gesucht.de/ ) or Ebay Kleinanzeigen (private online platform not only for flats but also second hand things (https://www.ebay-kleinanzeigen.de/). Get in touch with landlords there, In Deggendorf you can also apply for student housing. You can find all information about this here: https://www.th-deg.de/en/study-with-us/accommodation

patterns: When should I apply for my master's thesis?
How many semesters do i have for my studies?
responses: You can register your master thesis at the beginning of your third study semester and thus complete your studies within the regular study period of three semesters. By the end of your fifth study semester at the very latest, you need to have registered your master thesis. We thus recommend applying approx. 3 months in advance to companies in order to obtain a practical thesis topic.

patterns: What are the scholarships available from the University?
How to apply for the scholarship?
How many scholarships are available?
responses: You can find all information about scholarships at DIT here: https://www.th-deg.de/en/study-with-us/funding, Here is a great page for scholarships in Germany that you can apply for independently from our university: https://www2.daad.de/deutschland/stipendium/datenbank/en/21148-scholarship-database/?status=&origin=&subjectGrps=&daad=&q=&page=1&back=1 ,We do have scholarships for national and international students, However we only give scholarships to students who already have studied here at least one semester. The grades students achieve here in Deggendorf as well as extracurricular activities are relevant and considered during the evaluation of the eligibility for scholarships, Furthermore, it is important to note that our scholarships are a one-time-help, and are not sufficient for financing day-to-day life here.

patterns: What are the course requirements for application to my desired course?
What are the course requirements fro Master Mechatronic and Cyber-Physical Systems?
What are the course requirements fro Master Artificial Intelligence for Smart Sensors and Actuators?
responses: You can find the requirements on the course website. Here you can find all the course choices:https://www.th-deg.de/en/study-with-us/course-choices

Select your desired course and you will find the basic requirements in the course fact sheet. In detail you will find them in the study and exam regulations: https://www.th-deg.de/en/students/documents

patterns: What I need to do after receiving admission letter?
responses: After admission you have to enrol for your desired course. You will find all relevant information in your admission letter. Usually you have to upload some more documents in the PRIMUSS portal. Here you can find relevant enrolment documents: https://www.th-deg.de/en/students/documents#enrolment-documents
Get started with our Quiescent or Survival Guide: https://th-deg.de/info-for-freshers

patterns: How can I get student ID cards?
From Where can I get students ID cards?
responses: It will be sent to current address in Germany via mail after your enrolment.

The current height of the student service fee you can find here: https://www.th-deg.de/en/students/documents#fees

patterns: What is career newsletter? And how it's helpful?
Where is career newsletter?
How is career newsletter can help me?
responses: You get job offers via e-mail regularly. You can find the same job offers there as in on the DIT online job board (https://pmit-ext.th-deg.de/okb/app/index?lang=en_GB). So, if you are looking for a part-time job, a Bachelor or Master Thesis position or a full-time job, it will be helpful for you.

patterns: How can I transfer my previous course credits to this course?
What should I do if I have similar course structure from my previous studies?
Can I transfer my previous course credits to this course?
Can I transfer my previous course credits to my course?
responses: If you have already covered a similar module during your previous studies and wish to transfer the credit points to your current study programme, please click on: https://www.th-deg.de/en/students/documents#accordion-application-for-recognition , The recognition form to be filled in is listed under the faculty your study programme belongs to (Campus Cham – Faculty of Applied Natural Sciences and Industrial Engineering). Upon filling in the form, you need to send this document to the lecturer of the module you want to have recognised

If applicable, you can apply for a recognition of credit points for modules that are similar both in content and volume. If you have already covered a similar module during your previous studies and wish to transfer the credit points to your current study programme, please click on: https://www.th-deg.de/en/students/documents#accordion-application-for-recognition The recognition form to be filled in is listed under the faculty your study programme belongs to (Campus Cham – Faculty of Applied Natural Sciences and Industrial Engineering). Upon filling in the form, you need to send this document to the lecturer of the module you want to have recognised.

patterns: What is the objective of Sensor?
responses: analysis of functionality and lifetime of sensors and use of sensors for AI related application development

patterns: What kind of sensors are analyzed?
responses: magnetic angle sensors, pressure sensors, speed sensors

patterns: What equipment is being used?
What type of equipments are used in laboratory?
responses: furnaces, sen functionality test systems, GPU server (soon), temperature cycling chamber (soon)

patterns: Who is working in the lab?
Who is working in the laboratory?
responses: Students doing thesis and projects

patterns: What kind of lifetime stress is being applied?
responses: mainly HTxOL (High temperature operating life with sensor specific additional stress condition (= x), TC (temperature cycling)

patterns: What are typical projects in this lab?
responses: Development and Implementation of sensor functionality test systems, investigation of sensor lifetime, analysis of usability of machine learning methods for sensor lifetime prediction

patterns: Where is the sensor lab?
Where is the sensorlab?
Where is sensor lab?
Where is sensorlab?
responses: At DIT campus cham: Near inovation lab(Lab-6)
